predictions.text: Euro area August 2025 core HICP (Eurostat, flash) will be between 2.6% and 2.9% year-over-year.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify using Eurostat flash HICP release for August 2025. Core HICP defined as HICP excluding energy and unprocessed food. Success if reported YoY rate is ≥2.6% and ≤2.9%.
evidence: EU to remove tariffs on U.S. industrial goods, hinting at easing goods-price pressures (transatlantic supply chains) https://www.cnbc.com/2025/08/28/eu-tariffs-us-trade-trump-autos.html
Oil price pressures have risen but not spiked decisively into late August; core remains driven by services/wages.
monitoring_signals: Germany, Spain, France August CPI flash prints
Euro area services PMI price components
Brent and European natural gas prices
Wage growth indicators (ECB/Eurostat)
predictions.rationale: Goods disinflation continues while services cool modestly; energy passthrough limited so core likely high-2s.

predictions.text: U.S. ISM Services PMI (August 2025, headline) will print at or above 51.0.
predictions.verification_criteria: Use the Institute for Supply Management’s official August 2025 Services PMI headline index. Success if reported value ≥51.0.
evidence: Q2 U.S. GDP revised to 3.3% indicates resilient demand in services-heavy economy https://www.cnbc.com/2025/08/28/us-economy-grew-3point3percent-in-q2-growth-was-stronger-than-initially-thought.html
Retail bifurcation but still solid categories (Ulta, Dick’s) suggest services spending resilience https://www.cnbc.com/2025/08/28/gap-gap-q2-2025-earnings.html
monitoring_signals: S&P Global U.S. Services PMI (final) trajectory
High-frequency card spend on travel/leisure
Airline load factors and hotel occupancy
Job openings in services (JOLTS) and hiring intentions
predictions.rationale: Services activity remains expansionary despite softer goods; labor demand and consumer spend still support ≥51.

predictions.text: U.S. unemployment rate (U-3) for August 2025 will be between 4.2% and 4.4%.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify with BLS Employment Situation report for August 2025. Success if the seasonally adjusted U-3 rate is ≥4.2% and ≤4.4%.
evidence: Pending home sales decline and financing strains imply some cooling in labor-intensive housing-related services https://www.cnbc.com/2025/08/28/pending-home-sales-july-canceled-contracts-spike.html

AI-linked job displacement pressures entry-level segments, potentially nudging unemployment higher https://www.cnbc.com/2025/08/28/generative-ai-reshapes-us-job-market-stanford-study-shows-entry-level-young-workers.html
monitoring_signals: Initial and continuing jobless claims
Household survey employment and participation rate
NFIB hiring plans and JOLTS openings
Challenger job-cut announcements
predictions.rationale: Labor market cooling at the margin with modest uptick from tight conditions; range hedges survey noise.

predictions.text: NYMEX Henry Hub natural gas front-month futures (CME: NG) will settle at or above $3.20/MMBtu at least once by 2025-10-15.
predictions.verification_criteria: Use CME Group official daily settlement price for the prompt (front-month) Henry Hub natural gas futures contract. Success if any settlement on or before 2025-10-15 is ≥$3.20/MMBtu.
evidence: Seasonal shoulder-to-winter transition and potential hurricane risks can tighten balances.
Power burn remains elevated with hot summer tail; storage trajectories matter (EIA weekly).
monitoring_signals: EIA weekly storage injections vs 5-year average
NOAA hurricane outlook and Gulf of Mexico production impacts
Power sector gas burn and coal-to-gas switching
Lower-48 dry gas production and pipeline maintenance
predictions.rationale: Seasonality, weather risk, and modest demand strength provide a path to at least one $3.20+ settle.

predictions.text: At the September 2025 FOMC meeting, the Federal Reserve will lower the federal funds target range by at least 50 basis points.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify via the FOMC statement on decision day. Success if the target range midpoint is reduced by ≥50 bps versus prior setting.
evidence: Fed Governor Waller backs a series of rate cuts over the next six months, signaling an easing bias https://www.marketwatch.com/story/feds-waller-backs-a-series-of-interest-rate-cuts-over-the-next-six-months-f1f730bb
Cooling housing and rising cancellations indicate tighter financial conditions biting demand https://www.cnbc.com/2025/08/28/pending-home-sales-july-canceled-contracts-spike.html
Central bank independence tensions could favor decisive early easing to stabilize outlook.
monitoring_signals: CME FedWatch probabilities for 50 bps vs 25 bps
August CPI and PPI prints
August payrolls and unemployment rate
Fedspeak from core leadership ahead of blackout
predictions.rationale: Easing bias plus softer activity data raise odds of a front-loaded 50 bps move.

predictions.text: U.S. CPI-U headline m/m (seasonally adjusted) for August 2025 will be between 0.2% and 0.4%.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify using BLS CPI news release for August 2025. Success if headline CPI month-over-month SA change is ≥0.2% and ≤0.4%.
evidence: National average gasoline prices have firmed into late August (energy uplift).
Core goods disinflation and moderating shelter temper upside; services still sticky but easing at margin.
monitoring_signals: AAA daily national gasoline price averages
Wholesale gasoline and PPI for energy
Manheim used vehicle index
Apartment rent indices and OER leads
predictions.rationale: Energy adds to headline while core components moderate; likely a 0.3% center with 0.2–0.4% band.

predictions.text: From 2025-08-29 close to 2025-09-30 close, iShares Semiconductor ETF (SOXX) will underperform Invesco QQQ Trust (QQQ) by at least 3.0 percentage points based on adjusted close prices.
predictions.verification_criteria: Use adjusted close prices from a consistent source (e.g., Yahoo Finance). Compute (SOXX_return − QQQ_return); success if ≤ −3.0 percentage points between 2025-08-29 and 2025-09-30 closes.
evidence: AI hardware divergence: some suppliers sliding on softer outlooks vs AI hype https://www.cnbc.com/2025/08/28/pure-storage-stock-soars-to-record-meta-deal-bolsters-results-outlook.html
Nvidia’s revenue concentration risk highlights fragility in semis leadership https://www.cnbc.com/2025/08/28/nvidias-top-two-mystery-customers-made-up-39percent-of-its-q2-revenue-.html
monitoring_signals: Guidance and capex updates from hyperscalers (Meta, Amazon, Microsoft, Google)
Export controls headlines for China-related semis
Relative momentum: NVDA/QQQ, SOXX breadth vs mega-cap software
Rates volatility impacting long-duration growth equities
predictions.rationale: Concentration risk and mixed supplier outlooks raise odds of semis lagging broader mega-cap tech.
